result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Patrick Grant Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald Patrick Grant Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court for Ronald Patrick Grant Jr.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 11, 12 and 15.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 14 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

State request remand. Court grants and orders REMAND

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ronald Patrick Grant Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court for Ronald Patrick Grant Jr.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Motion for severance heard. For reasons stated on the record,  Court grants motion for severance. State to proceed with counts 11-15 for jury trial date on 10-24-2022. Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. State places offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 4.
Second to State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Response to Motion to Sever, filed.
Defendant's Motion to Sever Charges, filed.

Defendant Ronald Patrick Grant Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court for Ronald Patrick Grant Jr.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pretrial. Amended Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense requesting adjournment of final pretrial and advises of motion for severance. Court grants adjournment of final pretrial. Court orders defense's brief due on 9-26-2022 and state response 10-03-2022. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Case in court for final pretrial, however defense in trial on another case. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for final pretrial, however defense in trial on another case. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Supplement to State's Witness List, received and filed.

Defense in trial on another case. Defense request adjournment to 9-16-2022. Court grants. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Ronald Patrick Grant not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald Patrick Grant in court, appear by video with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson, appear in person.  Defendant Ronald Patrick Grant in custody.  John Rejowski appeared in person for Ian F Vance-Curzan for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J.Sokolowski.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Reed in court on behalf of public defender's office.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for State vs Lee hearing. Atty Reed advises found appointment just today with Atty Scott Anderson. Court finds good cause for extensions of time for prelim for reasons stated on the record. Case adjourned in prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald Patrick Grant not in court, defendant in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on standby. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald Patrick Grant not in court, defendant in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on standby. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald Patrick Grant not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders bail $30,000.00 cash bail with turn over to justice point. Level 5 supervision with GPS monitoring (release for only school and medical appointments) and all other previously ordered conditions. If GPS is not available, cash alternative will be $50,000.00 cash bail,wait list for GPS, home confinement.

Attorney Colleen Cullen in court, defendant Ronald Patrick Grant not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State advises of victim notification. Arguments heard as to defense's bail request. Court orders bail $30,000.00 cash bail with turn over to justice point. Level 5 supervision with GPS monitoring (release for only school and medical appointments) and all other previously ordered conditions. If GPS is not available, cash alternative will be $50,000.00 cash bail,wait list for GPS, home confinement. Case adjourned for prelim.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: 
K.P. and her children Je.B., Jo.B., Ja.B., JB, and CH (victims of 9/2/21 shooting incident)
M.R. (witness to 9/2/21 shooting)
Nacyrion K Butler, Dionta'e L Hayes (co-occupants of Kia Sportage during 10/18/21 fleeing)
Myles A Eskreeves, Cequille McNeil, Kurtis Evans, Jacari Hayes, Dairryon Fowler, Javarius Fowler (occupants of
silver vehicle from 9/2/21 shooting incident)
M.M. (owner of stolen Kia driven on 10/18/21)
R.N.R. (victim/driver of vehicle crashed into on 10/18/21).  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ronald Patrick Grant in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Ronald Patrick Grant in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ronald Patrick Grant appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 10 and 13.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
